So please follow the mission instructions.

When things bubble up from the past it really annoys us. The MMO appreciate simple systems we all can understand, equality in the workforce and a true future for mankind. It appears that the viral outbreak of the past, where P.E.T.s went rogue is equally responsible for this outbreak. Even your help is valuable in bringing about a resolution.
Puppet Master

Seems we might have a main P.E.T. out there who keeps rewriting the others protocols, ensuring we can’t control them. Whatever the method, it simply appears that these P.E.T.s need to be destroyed. Nothing else will resolve the issue now and if we can’t stop the source, we’ll never stop the infection. Please act in our best interests, citizen.

All the evidence is pointing to something else rewriting the code of the rogue P.E.T.s as everything the MMO throws at them is overridden. When it was first formed the EIC created this type of back-door, in order to control their people. Not that we’re blaming you, pilot, you’re just a pawn in their plans. Better to help us with ours.

With the evidence you’ve gathered and with a bit of co-ordination with the other companies, which the MMO arranged of course, we can see that there appears to be another, more powerful, P.E.T. out there. We’re hoping you can keep your agenda clear to help us finally solve these problems and will honor our agreements if you finish the job.
Top of the Tree

It appears that this problem is of our own making. Whilst others have recently raised their heads, like the Ministry, as well as the continued elimination of our facilities on the Rim, it appears this is down to us. We should have cleaned out the deepest regions of space, where these P.E.T.s have been slowly adapting themselves. We will learn from our errors.

The MMO are sure a companywide issue throughout the known galaxy created these events. So we’re all to blame but whilst the EIC blusters about and the VRU seem to fail to acknowledge their part of this the MMO have taken action. We still need you to prove you’re better than the rest of your organization so please continue.

I know you’re proud of the genetic spread of the VRU but let me be clear to you. It’s the MMO who started negotiations to finally end this issue and it will be the MMO who people trust in the future. We’re willing to admit our hand in this problem, as it appears P.E.T.s were missed during the last outbreak. Please resolve this.
Of Our Own Making

Citizen. The earlier reports about unusual protocols have made us analyze the data we gathered and realize that a new Protocol for the P.E.T.s is possible. We’re delighted to share this news for you and have also been developing a special reward for you, once this crisis is over. You’re almost there, comrade. You’re almost there.

It seems what we’re learning from our research is that new protocols may be available. Ones that we’ll be ensuring aid the MMO pilots as they reach further towards the stars in order to spread our word of unity. I know you’re sad your imperialist company cannot say the same. Nevertheless, we’re planning a great reward when all is done.

The techs at MMO HQ have defined a new level of protocol from the evidence you and our pilots gathered. Clearly, the MMO gathered more of the vital evidence. Which means potential enhancements to P.E.T.’s. Helping us spread the word of our efficiency further. Time to complete the last couple of jobs for us, before you go.
Practical Results

The final mission we have for you will pit you against this rogue Alpha P.E.T. To commemorate your victory we’ve managed to develop something special for you. One that, when integrated with the rewards that the EIC and VRU are providing, produces an equally good reward. Just remember that the tech at the heart is still MMO!

Before we re-establish the Warbond it is important to recognize your services to the MMO. So once you’ve taken out the Alpha P.E.T. we’ll give you something special, to commemorate your time with us. We know in the future you’ll realize we’re the better organization. Now head out and destroy the final threat.

We have to grudgingly admit that you’ve been helpful. Although your sense of etiquette is far too overdeveloped for the workings of our trueborn people. However it is good to show you the other and better way of doing things and before the Warbond is established we’d like to thank you for your help. Now tidy up this last thing.
Battle for Control

Good Day. This is a General Distress Call from Earth Industries Corporation. It appears we’re having a spot of bother with a few of our machines. If someone out there could help us out that would be wonderful. No need to rush… Well to be honest if you could rush a little that would be awfully helpful.

Pilots of the EIC. We need to inform you of some technical problems we’ve discovered in the last few days which seem to be spreading through our systems. I think we’ve been hacked. It appears that some of our technology has gone haywire so it would be great if you could get out there and help. This is not a request!

Hey there pilots. Something has gone wrong with my mum’s communications array. Which means I can broadcast into VRU territory from EIC military comms. What a rush! I just wanted to say that we all think you in the VRU stink! But mum is asking if you can help us out anyway, as the washing machine appears to be on the blink!
Empirical Data

Smashing job there, pilot. I always thought that you MMO people were a little bit backwards but it seems you know how to complete a mission. I’d just like to explain that I’m not officially speaking on behalf of the EIC, but I’m sure, given the circumstances, that we can ask for more of your aid. “Bound for Victory”, as we say! You ready?

Captain, I’m releasing you from the Warbond for now. It appears this virus has affected all the EIC communications and all and sundry are broadcasting out and seeking aid. Some of the other main companies have come to their aid too. There’s a lot going on at the moment and as we try and get control back, we have another mission for you.

It’s so cool I’m telling you what to do. While the image on your communication screen is still the high commander. So now pilot, you’re working for me and will follow my instructions! Oops, sorry of that sounded all official, it’s my first time doing this. You can call me Billy if that helps. I seem to be getting emergency signals, can you help them out?
War of Words

Well done you! It appears you managed to smash those blighters to smithereens. You MMO people are quite blunt when dealing with this stuff. It also appears that P.E.T.s seem to be infected as well. Heard that they’re going rogue all across space. Hope you’re the person to deal with this while I mix myself an itty bitty cocktail.

Believe me pilot, however bad you think things are at your end, they’re a million-and-one times worse here. We’ve got all types of idiots flooding our feed, yet luckily they seem to be directing pilots from the other factions. This problem seems to be spreading and so we need to get on top of things now, before they really go out of control.

Even for smelly old VRU you seem a little cool. But, don’t let my dad catch my dad saying that. I just keep getting all these distress signals about P.E.T.s here on my panel and am forwarding them to you and the other pilots out there. I reckon I could do this as a job. Let me try my important voice again. ‘Your company needs you. Act now!’
P.E.T. Problems

Shame you’re not here to share a drink. I do seem to be all alone with this communication feed and the bar, which I accidently was locked into. Still, I see myself as looking after the place, so I guess the owner owes me a few drinks. Something here says a young Boy called Billy released the virus. Guess he’ll be in trouble, like we’ll be without your help!

The virus seems to have been sitting dormant in an application which need a special code to trigger it, and one child in the EIC seems to have managed to unlock that code. This simply is not my day, I’m going to have to cancel my dinner plans. Although there seem to be leaks in MMO and VRU territories too. Please try to stem the problems.

So, I was playing this game, and then I saw this hack sheet online and decided to try it out so I could top the leaderboards. So awesome being inside the code and found this thing called a ‘Doomsday Code’, so I triggered it. After that, the communications started redirecting themselves. How awesome was that?
Released into the Wild

Well, that dry martini went down awfully well and I’ve found a book on how to make other cocktails. So I’m about to have a fabulous time. What’s that you say. Next objective. Well, my next objective is to get outrageously… Oh! Your next objective! Why didn’t you say? I’ve sent it to your mission objectives panel. Looks like a lot of fun.

The boffins have come up with a plan, which might disrupt the P.E.T.s, as they seem to be the main source of the infection. If you can follow the instructions in the mission objectives, we can hopefully quell this and stop it turning into a disaster. Luckily, it’s affecting all the companies so there’s no chance of a pre-emptive strike.

Mum is telling me I need to go to bed soon. I think that stinks and I told her that I was doing vital stuff for the EIC. Not sure she believed me, she also said she has had some messages from EIC Command asking about my name. Like I started this whole problem, duh! Anyway, you have a mission to do, get to it.
Close Down

The screen is a little blurred, but I think it says here that your last mission was an unmitigated success. Congratulations, you! Unfortunately, even though you were successful it appears the problems are still ongoing. This is thirsty work. Wonder who’s controlling those P.E.T.s. Sounds like a job for my favorite pilot, eh!

The data you gathered there was invaluable. It definitely proves that there’s another source, which is overwriting the antiviral code we created. One that seems to be coming from deep space. We’re starting to get the communication streams back in control now, which means we’ll be able to triangulate our methods better. Get back out there!

No, mum, no! I need to tell the VRU pilot what to do next. I know it’s past my bedtime but pleeaassee. You always said I had a lot of potential, so look. I’m using my potential now. Pilot, I think there’s another source of the virus out there you need to suppress. Mum tells me I’ve got to get ready for bed now.
Out of Control

So, we’re the best team, aren’t we. You doing the action out there and me monitoring you from this lovely bar, with all its lovely drinks. This one is green, it looks just like a big, big… erm… green thing. Now, on the special screen it says there may be an Alpha P.E.T. What’s one of those then? I wonder if it’s in my cocktail book?

Everything is pointing to a rogue Alpha P.E.T. out there. Although we’ll need to pin down its location and we can only do this with your dedicated aid. We’re planning a special reward for you when this is all over, pilot. The team in the labs have become quite excited about what you might have discovered. More later. Act now!

This is Billy’s mum. I’m not sure what he’s told you but he’s been a very, very, very naughty boy. If he’s responsible for all of this then I don’t know what his dad is going to say. It also tells me you’re a VRU pilot, I’m not sure I should even be talking to you. Sorry? The next mission! Well press accept and get on with it then.
Top Dog

I think I’m a little bit tipsy. It’s like every bottle has a myriad of glowing stars which are making me a little dizzy and… Sorry, just fell off my chair. I’d say that this whole thing is our own fault. We create new things and then they come and attack us. It’s like the movies, we’re all going to die. Sorry, sorry, I’ll compose myself a little better next time!

Given the effects of this virus have affected most of humanity I don’t think they relate to anything but the precious time the P.E.T’s went wild. This just shows what happens when you don’t clean up properly. Although the weight of the blame obviously lands in the MMO and VRU’s hands. A few more missions and we’ll be clear.

No, no! I’m still here. Apparently your transmission is just coming straight back to Billy’s computer now. I’ve been told to keep feeding you information… just let me read this… ‘Even though you are a mortal enemy!’ Did you follow that? It says there are a few missions to complete still. Here’s the next one.
None of Your Concern

Whatcha sayin’? Do I even know you… or trust you. Well, you have a nice voice and I really, really like nice voices. Like nectar on a rainy day. Tee he! Think they’re going to take back control from me now. But, sshhhh! I didn’t tell you but I think they’ve uncovered a new P.E.T. protocol. Whatever that is it sounds neat! Hic!

Really glad this is coming to an end, pilot. With the failure in communications systems and a selection of other problems, we seem to be finally getting control of this thing. The other companies have even done their minor parts. Surprising I know! That think we discovered in the lab. Seems we’ve uncovered a new P.E.T. protocol!

The EIC say they’re going to be taking back control of communications in the next few minutes, so I’ll say goodbye now, before you go. I quite enjoyed telling you what to do for a while, seems better than my job as a manager of a space haulage firm. There’s talk here of a new P.E.T. protocol. Good luck on your travels!
Laboratory Analysis

This is EIC Command. We’ve regained control of this communications channel and would like to assure you that the person you were speaking to was not representative of our office. We appreciate your help at this difficult time and would like to reward you for your actions. Please destroy the rogue Alpha P.E.T. to receive this reward!

Finally, we have control of all our communications channels again. Thanks for your patience and help, pilot. You’ve done the EIC proud in this difficult time. It’s hard to put a value on what you’ve done but our accounting division have done just that, and we’ve a special reward for you if you just kill that damn rogue Alpha P.E.T.

Greetings, pilot. We have to thank you for your assistance at this trying time and apologize for the junior spaceman who seems to have been ordering you about. It is not our policy to allow communications to fail, but I think you’re aware of the circumstances. If you destroy that Alpha P.E.T. then we’ll reward you well.
Final Call

Good Day. This is a General Distress Call from Earth Industries Corporation. It appears we’re having a spot of bother with a few of our machines. If someone out there could help us out that would be wonderful. No need to rush… Well to be honest if you could rush a little that would be awfully helpful.

Pilots of the EIC. We need to inform you of some technical problems we’ve discovered in the last few days which seem to be spreading through our systems. I think we’ve been hacked. It appears that some of our technology has gone haywire so it would be great if you could get out there and help. This is not a request!

I just wanted to say that we all think you in the VRU stink! But mum is asking if you can help us out anyway, as the washing machine appears to be on the blink!

Let me try my important voice again. ‘Your company needs you. Act now!’

Well, my next objective is to get outrageously… Oh! Your next objective! Why didn’t you say? I’ve sent it to your mission objectives panel. Looks like a lot of fun.

Finally, we have control of all our communications channels again. Thanks for your patience and help, pilot. You’ve done the EIC proud in this difficult time. It’s hard to put a value on what you’ve done but our accounting division have done just that, and we’ve a special reward for you if you just kill that damn rogue Alpha P.E.T.

Greetings, pilot. We have to thank you for your assistance at this trying time and apologize for the junior spaceman who seems to have been ordering you about. It is not our policy to allow communications to fail, but I think you’re aware of the circumstances. If you destroy that Alpha P.E.T. then we’ll reward you well.
Final Call

Det er længe siden, vi sidst talte sammen, pilot. Jeg tænkte, at du måske ignorerede mig og havde fået nye venner? Bare rolig, du er her nu, og vi kan samarbejde om at yde modstand mod alientruslen. Mens du får belønninger for at skyde dem i stykker, sender jeg nogle af de fjernstyrede ud for at scanne efter ændringer i teknikken! Aftale?
Teknikindsamling

Jeg er bekymret over, hvor mange andre, du har arbejdet for på det seneste. Du kunne få alle mulige dårlige vaner fra dem. Det er langt bedre, at du fortsætter med at arbejde for mere passende venner såsom Nyx – og mig selvfølgelig. Lad dig ikke påvirke af de andre. Vi har din ryg, husk det!
Spredning af indflydelse

Vi leger en farlig leg nu, ligesom hvis vi løb med knive i mørke. Vi presser aliensene tilbage, men der strømmer flere og flere til vores område. Jeg frygter, at der er noget på færde, hvor de kommer fra, siden de foretrækker at kæmpe mod mennesker og hinanden i en krigszone. Noget er i forandring, og det er ikke godt!
At løbe med knive

Du har klaret det godt, pilot. Du har udfordret aliensene og sørget for, at de forstod budskabet. Men jeg ved, at nogle af jer vil vise, at I er de allerbedste. Hjælp med at sikre vores territorier i rummet, og sørg for, at handlende og andre civile skibe kan færdes sikkert.
Toppen af poppen

Mens du får belønninger for at skyde dem i stykker, sender jeg nogle af de fjernstyrede ud for at scanne efter ændringer i teknikken! Aftale?

Toppen af poppen
